page.title: 05ST. MARY'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Found in the Sheffield Diocese it is about 800 years old. The present rector the thirty_eighth is Mr. Matthews.A non working clock on the west wall, made in 1710,has the name Gertrude Copley written on it.Pictures on the pew ends show two people facing each other to represent marriage, another shows two people back to back to show divorce.The last one shows a man with three faces it is thought to show deceitfulness.There's a pulpit with a sounding board over it to project the Rectors voice.A South Wall chapel was built by the Copley family. Near the the west wall is a pew end which hasn't been finished and is thought to mean that no matter how we try we can never do a job properly for God.The Rector performs 15 Weddings,22 Funerals and 30 Christenings annually. The Congregation numbers about 100.
